revised_title: A Novel Method for Measuring Thermal Conductivity
tldr: The authors developed a method to measure the conductivity of heat in bad conductors by using a thin metallic layer, such as Dutch leaf, to supply heat. They placed copper plates above and below the heater to maintain a uniform temperature and reduce the impact of uneven thickness in the metallic layers. This method allowed them to estimate the heat loss and improve the accuracy of their measurements.
